Class Budget

java.lang.Object
income.Budget
public class Budget extends Object
Manages a user's personal budget, expenses, incomes, and financial goals.

This class provides comprehensive budget management functionality including:

  • Budget setting and tracking
  • Expense management with category tracking
  • Income tracking with source information
  • Financial goal setting with target dates
  • Reminders with email notification capability
  • Donation tracking
  • Debt tracking
  • Data persistence through file storage

Budget constraints are enforced when adding new expenses, ensuring users cannot exceed their set budget limits.

See Also:
  • Expense
  • Income
  • Goal
  • Reminder
  • Debt
  • Donate

      Creates a budget and loads existing data from the specified file.

  • Method Details

    • setBudget

      public void setBudget(double budget)
      Sets the budget to a new amount.
      Parameters:
      budget - The new budget amount

    • getBudget

      public double getBudget()
      Retrieves the current budget amount.
      Returns:
      The current budget amount

    • addExpense

      public void addExpense(double amount, String category)
      Adds a new expense if it doesn't exceed the budget.

      If adding this expense would cause the total expenses to exceed the budget, the addition is rejected with a warning message.

      Parameters:
      amount - The expense amount
      category - The category of the expense

    • addIncome

      public void addIncome(double amount, String source)
      Adds a new income source to the budget.
      Parameters:
      amount - The income amount
      source - The source of the income

    • addGoal

      public void addGoal(double amount, String date)
      Adds a new financial goal with target amount and date.
      Parameters:
      amount - The target amount for the goal
      date - The target date to achieve the goal

    • addReminder

      public void addReminder(String title, String date)
      Adds a new reminder with title and date.
      Parameters:
      title - The title/description of the reminder
      date - The date for the reminder

    • addDonate

      public void addDonate(double amount, String source)
      Adds a new donation if it doesn't exceed the budget.

      If adding this donation would cause the total donations to exceed the budget, the addition is rejected with a warning message.

      Parameters:
      amount - The donation amount
      source - The recipient of the donation

    • addDebt

      public void addDebt(double amount, String source)
      Adds a new debt repayment if it doesn't exceed the budget.

      If adding this debt would cause the total debts to exceed the budget, the addition is rejected with a warning message.

      Parameters:
      amount - The debt repayment amount
      source - The creditor of the debt

    • sendReminder

      public void sendReminder(Budget bt, Scanner external_input)
      Sends an email reminder for a specific date.

      This method:

      1. Retrieves the current user's email and username from the database
      2. Searches for reminders matching the specified date
      3. Uses the Mailjet API to send an email reminder
      Parameters:
      bt - The budget object containing reminders
      external_input - Scanner for user input to specify the reminder date

    • saveData

      public void saveData(String filename)
      Saves the current budget data to a file.

      This method writes the budget amount and all expenses to the specified file.

      Parameters:
      filename - The full path of the file to save the data to
